schedule.strategy: Quality over quantity - build returning viewers through episodic series
schedule.posting_philosophy: 3 strategic posts per week aligned with data-proven content types and OPTIMAL TIMES

Tuesday.description: AI tool demonstrations with visual transformations
Tuesday.current_performance: 64.72% avg (26 videos, 76.6 avg views) at OLD 15:00 time
Tuesday.expected_behavior: High rewatch rate, reference content, save & share
Tuesday.historical_performance: 461.73% rewatch on Text-to-3D (video_id: MNuKOhfrYNA), 70.02% on Canva (mSGszYOlRKs)
Tuesday.reasoning: YOUR 78-video analytics PROVE 23:00 UTC (6 PM EST) = 82.1% completion vs 34.0% at 15:00 UTC. Tool demos are your BEST performers.

Thursday.description: AI tool demonstrations (SAME format as Tuesday, different tools)
Thursday.current_performance: Combined with Tuesday data: 64.72% avg at OLD times
Thursday.expected_behavior: Same as Tuesday - high reference value, rewatches
Thursday.reasoning: YOUR analytics prove 21:00 UTC (4 PM EST) = 57.9% completion. Replicates Tuesday success with different tools.
Thursday.alternative_option: SECRET PROMPTS after format pivot to ChatGPT-specific prompts

Friday.description: Entertainment-focused AI content (moved from Saturday for +11% boost)
Friday.expected_behavior: New viewer acquisition, viral potential, shares
Friday.reasoning: YOUR data shows Friday is BEST day (77.63%) + 23:00 is BEST time (82.1%). Combining both = maximum performance.
Friday.quality_gate: ONLY entertainment/shock-value AI stories. Reject generic news.
Friday.timezone_note: 23:00 UTC = 6:00 PM EST Friday (weekend starts, high engagement)
Friday.replaces: Saturday AI News Roundup (killed for 32.21% underperformance)

tool_teardown_tuesday.hook_structure: Show visual transformation in first 3 seconds (PROVEN on Text-to-3D)
tool_teardown_tuesday.cta: Next Thursday: [Teaser for next tool]. Subscribe so you don't miss it!
required_elements: Before/after visual comparison (CRITICAL - Text-to-3D had 461.73% because of this)
Specific tool name in title (NOT 'this AI tool')
examples: Tool Teardown Tuesday - Episode 5: Midjourney's SECRET Parameter Creates Perfect Images!
Tool Teardown Tuesday - Episode 6: Notion's HIDDEN AI Builds Your Workflow in 60 Seconds!

tool_teardown_thursday.hook_structure: IDENTICAL to Tuesday - show visual transformation in first 3 seconds
tool_teardown_thursday.cta: Next Tuesday: [Teaser for next tool]. Friday I reveal [entertainment teaser]!
required_elements: SAME as Tuesday - different tool, same proven format
examples: Tool Teardown Thursday - Episode 5: ChatGPT's HIDDEN Code Interpreter Magic!
Tool Teardown Thursday - Episode 6: Runway Gen-3's SECRET Video Editing Feature!

differentiation_from_tuesday.rule: Cover DIFFERENT tools, not different formats

example_week.tuesday: Midjourney SECRET Parameter for Perfect Faces

differentiation_from_tuesday.avoid: Do not make Thursday different format - make it SAME FORMAT, different tool

secret_prompts_thursday.hook_structure: Show ChatGPT prompt on screen + immediate result in first 3 seconds
secret_prompts_thursday.cta: Episode [N+1] next Thursday reveals the [TEASER]! Subscribe now!
required_elements: Episode number MUST be in title
EXACT ChatGPT prompt visible on screen (copy-paste ready)
Specific use case (Email, Meetings, Content, Code)
examples: SECRET PROMPTS - Episode 1: ChatGPT's Email Mastery Prompt!
SECRET PROMPTS - Episode 2: ChatGPT's Meeting Notes Automation!
SECRET PROMPTS - Episode 3: ChatGPT's Code Debugging Secret!

success_metrics.proven_format_baseline: 50-60% when using ChatGPT-specific format (video_ids: ut5wl2k_8bg, Wwp35tN5amY)

AVOID_AT_ALL_COSTS: Vague productivity angles without specific demo

viral_ai_friday.hook_structure: Lead with the shocking/entertaining moment in first 3 seconds, explain after
viral_ai_friday.cta: Tuesday: [Related practical tool]. Follow for the full breakdown!
required_elements: Shock value or entertainment angle (not just news)
Immediate WTF moment in first 3 seconds
Personal impact (how it affects viewer TODAY)
Bridge to Tuesday's related tool demo
examples: Viral AI Friday - Episode 1: Rizzbot FLIPPED ME OFF on TikTok LIVE!
Viral AI Friday - Episode 2: Adobe AI Now RUNS Your Entire Social Media!
Viral AI Friday - Episode 3: AWS Outage Gave AI Literal Brain Rot!
exclusion_criteria: NO generic news without entertainment value
NO 'failed products' stories (proven 31.81% on video_id: fU8DgDdmRl4)

bridge_to_tuesday.rule: Always connect Friday entertainment to Tuesday practical tool
examples: Rizzbot went viral → Tuesday: ChatGPT SECRET Conversation Tricks
Adobe AI automation → Tuesday: Adobe Express HIDDEN Features
AWS AI failure → Tuesday: Local AI Tools That Never Go Down

ai_news_roundup.status: ⚠️ KILLED - Replaced by Viral AI Friday
ai_news_roundup.proven_performance: 32.21% avg completion (8 videos) - UNDERPERFORMED baseline by 17.8%
ai_news_roundup.reason_for_killing: Generic news (32.21%) performs 2.5x worse than entertainment (80.69%). Audience wants entertainment/practical tools, NOT news.

best_example.title: Google's AI Project Chronos Pulled: Defamation Lawsuit Looms!

worst_examples.title: Microsoft AI Agents FAILED: Project Nexus Shocking Truth!
worst_examples.why_failed: Negative framing, no entertainment or practical value

ai_news_roundup.replacement: Viral AI Friday - Entertainment-focused stories that perform 80.69% (2.5x better)

scheduling_notes.github_actions_reality: Delays of 0-120 minutes are normal and EXPECTED
scheduling_notes.window_strategy: 3-hour windows absorb delays while hitting target audience peak

optimal_times_proven.23:00_UTC: 6:00 PM EST - BEST TIME (82.1% completion, 10 videos sample)
optimal_times_proven.21:00_UTC: 4:00 PM EST - After-work peak (57.9% completion, 5 videos sample)
optimal_times_proven.22:00_UTC: 5:00 PM EST - Evening start (57.4% completion, 6 videos sample)

killed_times.14:00_UTC: 9:00 AM EST - WORST TIME (34.0% completion, 3 videos sample)

why_these_days.tuesday: Proven content success (64.72% avg) + BEST time slot (82.1% at 23:00 UTC) = HIGHEST priority
why_these_days.thursday: Mid-week engagement + after-work timing (57.9% at 21:00 UTC) + builds anticipation for Friday
why_these_days.friday: BEST DAY by analytics (77.63% avg) + BEST TIME (82.1% at 23:00 UTC) = maximum viral potential
why_these_days.saturday_REMOVED: Moved to Friday - Saturday only 66.53% vs Friday 77.63% (-11.1% performance gap)

why_3_posts_not_daily.problem: Daily posting = 99.7% new viewers (no retention, burnout)
why_3_posts_not_daily.solution: 3 strategic posts = viewers follow ALL episodes, build weekly habits
why_3_posts_not_daily.math: 3 quality posts at 70% completion > 7 mediocre posts at 30% completion
why_3_posts_not_daily.data_proof: Tool Teardown (episodic) = 64.72% avg vs Generic Daily Hacks = 22.3% avg

evening_vs_morning_data.insight: US audience (58.3%) watches YouTube evenings (after work/dinner), NOT mornings

analytics_validation.method: YouTube Analytics API hour-level completion tracking
analytics_validation.key_finding: Evening posts (21:00-23:00 UTC) average 65.8% completion vs morning posts (14:00-15:00 UTC) 34.0%

proven_best_days.reasoning: Highest day performance + weekend starts + evening timing = maximum viral potential
Proven content format (64.72%) + proven best time (82.1%) = highest consistency
Mid-week engagement + after-work window (4 PM EST) + builds Friday anticipation
Friday performs +11.1% better (77.63% vs 66.53%), moved content to Friday

worst_days.note: Insufficient isolated day data, but morning times (14:00-15:00 UTC) consistently underperform across all days

migration_plan.status: IN PROGRESS - Time optimization based on 78-video analytics

phase_1_IMMEDIATE.action: Switch Tuesday posts from 15:00 UTC → 23:00 UTC
phase_1_IMMEDIATE.success_criteria: ≥70% completion rate on both Tuesday posts
phase_1_IMMEDIATE.manual_or_automated: MANUAL first 2 posts to validate, then automate
phase_1_IMMEDIATE.if_failed: Investigate content quality (unlikely - 10 videos prove 23:00 works)

phase_2_EXPAND.action: Switch Thursday 15:00→21:00 UTC AND launch Friday 23:00 UTC (kill Saturday 14:00)

expected_results.friday: +11.1% vs old Saturday (77.63% day avg + 82.1% time slot = ~80% expected)

track_metrics: All 3 days performing above old baseline (34.0%)
Returning viewer % starting to grow (target: 5% by end of Phase 2)
phase_2_EXPAND.if_failed: Rollback time that underperformed, keep time that worked

phase_3_OPTIMIZE.action: Fine-tune series assignments and content formats
focus_areas: Fix Secret Prompts format (14.74% → 50%+ via ChatGPT-specific pivot)
Measure returning viewer growth (target: 10-15% by Week 8)
A/B test Friday entertainment vs Saturday to confirm Friday superiority
Consider adding Thursday Secret Prompts if Tool Teardown Thursday hits 65%+
phase_3_OPTIMIZE.success_criteria: All 3 posts averaging ≥60% completion, ≥5% returning viewers
phase_3_OPTIMIZE.if_successful: Lock in schedule, automate fully via cron
phase_3_OPTIMIZE.ongoing: Monthly analytics review, adjust only if performance drops <50%

phase_4_SCALE.consideration: IF all 3 posts consistently hit 70%+, consider adding Monday or Wednesday
phase_4_SCALE.constraint: ONLY if episodic series proven (returning viewers >10%)
phase_4_SCALE.reasoning: 4 posts/week still allows viewers to follow all episodes
phase_4_SCALE.do_not_exceed: 4 posts/week - avoid burnout and maintain quality over quantity

rollback_plan.trigger: If ANY time slot posts <40% completion for 2 consecutive weeks
rollback_plan.action: Revert THAT time slot to nearest proven time (21:00, 22:00, or 23:00 UTC)
investigate: Was content quality lower those weeks?
Was there external event affecting viewership?
rollback_plan.note: Rollback to 15:00 UTC NOT an option - proven 34.0% failure

cron_update_timing.when: After Phase 1 validates (2 successful Tuesday posts at 23:00 UTC)

analytics_reference.data_source: YouTube Analytics API backfill (83 videos, Oct 12 - Nov 8, 2025)
analytics_reference.confidence_level: HIGH (26 videos for tool_teardown, 8 for news, proven patterns)

proven_baselines.ai_news_roundup: 32.21% completion (KILLED - replaced by Viral AI Friday)
proven_baselines.viral_entertainment: 80.69% completion (proven on Rizzbot, now Viral AI Friday)
